battery_config.title: Battery Configuration
battery_config.description: Configure battery capacity and voltage (inverter settings only).

data_description.battery_capacity: Total amp-hour capacity of your battery bank
data_description.battery_voltage: CRITICAL: Must match your physical battery system voltage. Common values: 12V, 24V, 36V, or 48V. Incorrect voltage can damage equipment.
data_description.output_priority: Determines how the inverter prioritizes energy sources. Solar First uses solar power preferentially, Mains First uses grid power, SBU follows Solar-Battery-Utility priority.
data_description.polling_interval: How often to read data from the inverter via Bluetooth. Lower values provide more frequent updates but may impact Bluetooth performance. Recommended: 15-30 seconds.
data_description.enable_diagnostic_sensors: Enable sensors that track integration health, Bluetooth RSSI, connection quality, update duration, and error statistics. Useful for troubleshooting.
data_description.enable_calculated_sensors: Enable derived sensors like system efficiency, grid dependency, self-sufficiency ratio, and energy flow metrics. These calculate useful insights from raw data.
data_description.back_to_menu: Return to the main menu without saving any changes made on this page.

battery_management.title: Battery Management
battery_management.description: Configure battery charging, discharging, and protection settings.

data_description.max_charge_current: Overall maximum charging current from all sources (PV + AC)
data_description.max_ac_charge_current: Maximum current allowed when charging from AC grid power
data_description.pv_max_charge_current: Maximum charging current from solar panels. Should match your MPPT controller rating and battery specifications.
data_description.discharge_stop_soc: Battery discharge will stop at this SOC level to protect battery health. Recommended: 10-20% for lead-acid, 10-30% for lithium.
data_description.low_soc_alarm: An alarm will trigger when battery SOC drops below this level. Should be higher than Discharge Stop SOC.
data_description.switch_to_ac_soc: When battery SOC drops to this level, the system will switch to AC power if available. Should be higher than Discharge Stop SOC.
data_description.switch_to_battery_soc: When battery SOC reaches this level during charging, the system will switch to battery power. Typically 70-90%.
data_description.charge_source_priority: Determines which energy source charges the battery first. PV Priority uses solar first with AC backup, AC Priority uses grid first, Hybrid uses both simultaneously, PV Only uses only solar.
data_description.battery_type: CRITICAL: Select the exact chemistry of your batteries. Incorrect selection will cause improper charging voltages and may damage or destroy your batteries. When in doubt, select User Defined and configure voltages manually.
data_description.back_to_menu: Return to the main menu without saving any changes made on this page.
data_description.float_charge_voltage: Voltage to maintain battery at full charge (float stage)
data_description.bulk_charge_voltage: Target voltage for bulk/boost charging stage
data_description.battery_low_voltage: Voltage at which load is disconnected to protect battery
data_description.battery_shutdown_voltage: Critical voltage for immediate system shutdown
data_description.grid_charge_start_voltage: Battery voltage at which AC charging begins
data_description.battery_overvoltage: Voltage at which charging stops to prevent battery damage
data_description.battery_charge_limit_voltage: Maximum voltage allowed during charging cycle
data_description.battery_under_voltage: Voltage at which low battery warning is triggered
data_description.charge_max_temperature: Stop charging when battery exceeds this temperature
data_description.charge_min_temperature: Stop charging when battery below this temperature
data_description.discharge_max_temperature: Stop discharging when battery exceeds this temperature
data_description.discharge_min_temperature: Stop discharging when battery below this temperature
data_description.boost_charge_return_voltage: If voltage drops below this during float, restart boost charge
data_description.over_discharge_return_voltage: Battery voltage to resume after over-discharge protection
data_description.discharge_cutoff_soc: Stop discharging when battery SOC reaches this level
data_description.over_discharge_delay: Seconds to wait before cutting off load on low voltage
data_description.equalizing_charge_time: How long to maintain equalizing charge voltage
data_description.boost_charge_time: Maximum time for boost charging stage
data_description.stop_charge_current: Stop constant-voltage charging when current drops below this
data_description.stop_charge_soc: Stop charging when SOC reaches this percentage
data_description.soc_low_alarm: Trigger low battery alarm at this SOC
data_description.soc_switch_to_grid: In SBU mode, use grid when SOC drops to this level
data_description.soc_switch_to_battery: In SBU mode, switch back to battery when SOC rises to this
data_description.inverter_switch_voltage: Battery voltage to resume inverter operation after grid mode
data_description.battery_temp_compensation_enable: Adjust charge voltages based on battery temperature

inverter_output.title: Inverter Output Settings
inverter_output.description: Configure inverter output parameters and AC input settings. ⚠️ CRITICAL: Output voltage and frequency must match your region's electrical standards.

data_description.output_voltage: AC output voltage for your loads
data_description.output_frequency: AC output frequency for your loads
data_description.ac_input_range: Acceptable AC input voltage range. Narrow Range (UPS Mode): Strict tolerance for clean power, fast switching. Wide Range (Appliance Mode): Greater tolerance for generators and unstable grids, slower switching.
data_description.charge_source_priority: Determines which energy source charges the battery first. PV Priority: Solar first with AC backup. AC Priority: Grid first. Hybrid Mode: Both sources simultaneously. PV Only: Solar exclusively (disables AC charging).
data_description.power_saving_mode: When enabled, inverter enters low-power mode when load is below ~50W. Saves 10-20W idle consumption but adds ~20ms switching delay. Disable for UPS applications requiring instant response.
data_description.back_to_menu: Return to the main menu without saving any changes made on this page.
data_description.power_control: Turn inverter AC output on or off
data_description.grid_active_power_set: Target power to export to grid
data_description.grid_power_factor: Target power factor for grid export
data_description.zero_export_power: Target grid power in anti-export mode
data_description.hvrt_lvrt_enable: Stay connected during grid voltage fluctuations
data_description.grid_connect_voltage_low: Minimum voltage required for grid connection
data_description.grid_connect_voltage_high: Maximum voltage required for grid connection
data_description.grid_connect_frequency_low: Minimum frequency required for grid connection
data_description.grid_connect_frequency_high: Maximum frequency required for grid connection
data_description.battery_for_grid_enable: How battery participates in grid-tie mode

integration.title: Integration Settings
integration.description: Configure integration behavior and communication settings.

data_description.inverter_password: Optional password for writing configuration registers. Common defaults: 4321 (Menu/Setting), 0000 (Grid Parameter), 111111 or 1111 (Software/App). Set to 0 if no password required. Required for battery type, voltages, and other critical settings.
data_description.command_delay_write: Delay between write commands to the inverter. Write operations need more processing time than reads. Default: 0.5s. Increase if write commands fail frequently.
data_description.batch_read_delay: Delay between batch read operations. Allows the inverter time to process requests and respond. Default: 0.3s. Increase if experiencing CRC errors or timeouts.
data_description.connection_timeout: Maximum time to wait for BLE connection establishment. Default: 2000ms (2 seconds). Increase if connection fails in areas with BLE interference.
data_description.retry_attempts: Number of times to retry failed commands before giving up. Default: 3. Higher values improve reliability but slow down error recovery.
data_description.log_modbus_traffic: Enable detailed logging of all Modbus commands and responses. Useful for debugging communication issues. WARNING: Generates large log files.
data_description.clear_failed_registers: Clear the cache of registers that previously failed to read. Forces a re-scan of ALL registers on next update. Useful after firmware updates or when troubleshooting connectivity issues. Changes take effect on next data refresh.
data_description.back_to_menu: Return to the main menu without saving any changes made on this page.
data_description.rs485_address: Communication address for parallel or multi-device setups
data_description.alarm_enable: Enable audible alarm for faults and warnings
data_description.alarm_on_source_loss: Beep when grid or PV input is lost
data_description.record_faults: Save fault events to history log

expert.title: Expert Settings
expert.description: ⚠️ WARNING: These settings can damage equipment if configured incorrectly. Only proceed if you fully understand the implications. All changes are logged for audit purposes.

data.expert_mode_acknowledged: I understand the risks of modifying expert settings

data_description.expert_mode_acknowledged: ⚠️ REQUIRED: You must acknowledge that you understand the risks before modifying expert settings. Incorrect configuration can damage equipment, void warranties, and create safety hazards.
data_description.grid_voltage_low: ⚠️ CRITICAL: Grid voltage below this threshold triggers disconnect. Must comply with local electrical codes. Typical: 170-190V for 230V systems, 90-105V for 120V systems. Setting too low risks equipment damage.
data_description.grid_voltage_high: ⚠️ CRITICAL: Grid voltage above this threshold triggers disconnect. Must comply with local electrical codes. Typical: 250-280V for 230V systems, 130-140V for 120V systems. Setting too high risks equipment damage.
data_description.grid_frequency_low: ⚠️ CRITICAL: Grid frequency below this threshold triggers disconnect. Must comply with grid codes. Typical: 49.5Hz for 50Hz regions, 59.5Hz for 60Hz regions. Incorrect setting can damage motors and electronics.
data_description.grid_frequency_high: ⚠️ CRITICAL: Grid frequency above this threshold triggers disconnect. Must comply with grid codes. Typical: 50.5Hz for 50Hz regions, 60.5Hz for 60Hz regions. Incorrect setting can damage motors and electronics.
data_description.back_to_menu: Return to the main menu without saving any changes made on this page.

features.title: Enable/Disable Features
features.description: Control which sensors and entities are enabled in Home Assistant. NOTE: Number and Select entities are now automatically controlled by hardware feature detection. Use 'Re-detect Hardware Features' if your inverter capabilities have changed.

data_description.enable_diagnostic_sensors: Enable diagnostic sensors that track integration health: BLE RSSI, connection status, update duration, failed reads, CRC errors, and retry statistics. Useful for troubleshooting connection and performance issues.
data_description.enable_calculated_sensors: Enable calculated sensors that derive useful metrics: system efficiency, grid dependency, self-sufficiency ratio, PV utilization, battery contribution, and energy flow analysis. These provide insights beyond raw register data.
data_description.enable_energy_dashboard: Enable integration with Home Assistant's Energy Dashboard. Provides energy sensors in the correct format for tracking solar production, battery charge/discharge, grid import/export, and load consumption over time.
data_description.back_to_menu: Return to the main menu without saving any changes made on this page.

hardware_features.title: Hardware Feature Overrides
hardware_features.description: Override automatic hardware feature detection. These settings control which hardware-specific entities are visible in Home Assistant.

data_description.grid_tie: Enable grid-tied operation features including grid export monitoring, feed-in control, and grid synchronization settings. Entities: Grid Export Energy, Grid Voltage/Frequency, Grid Import Power.
data_description.diesel_mode: Enable diesel generator mode features for off-grid systems using generator backup. Entities: Generator priority settings, AC input source control.
data_description.three_phase: Enable three-phase power monitoring and control. Shows separate voltage, current, and power for each phase (L1, L2, L3). Only enable if your inverter is configured for three-phase operation.
data_description.split_phase: Enable split-phase (120V/240V) monitoring common in North American installations. Shows L1, L2, and neutral voltages. Only enable if your inverter supports split-phase output.
data_description.parallel_operation: Enable parallel operation features for multiple inverters working together. Shows parallel status, phase synchronization, and load sharing. Only enable if you have multiple inverters connected in parallel.
data_description.timed_operation: Enable time-based charging and discharging schedules. Allows setting up to 6 time periods for battery charging from grid or generator. Useful for time-of-use electricity rates.
data_description.advanced_output: Enable advanced output control features including output source priority, AC input voltage range, and transfer time settings. For expert users who need fine-grained control.
data_description.customized_models: Enable support for customized inverter models with non-standard register mappings or special features. Only enable if your inverter uses a custom firmware or has been modified.

user_preferences.title: User Preferences
user_preferences.description: Show or hide optional entity groups based on your system configuration. These settings control visibility only and do not affect inverter operation.

data_description.show_equalization_settings: Show battery equalization charge settings (voltage, time, interval, timeout). Only applicable to lead-acid batteries. Lithium batteries do not use equalization charging. Hide this if you have lithium batteries to reduce UI clutter.
data_description.show_pv2_settings: Show second PV panel monitoring (PV2 voltage, current, power). Only applicable if you have dual PV inputs connected to your inverter. Hide this if you only have one PV array to reduce UI clutter.
data_description.show_pv_settings: Show all solar panel monitoring and configuration entities (PV1, PV2, total power, charge current, energy). Hide this if you're not using solar panels (AC-only systems, generator-only systems) to reduce UI clutter.

redetect_hardware.title: Re-detect Hardware Features
redetect_hardware.description: Probe your inverter to detect available hardware features and update entity visibility based on detected capabilities.

data_description.confirm_redetection: Check this box to start hardware feature detection. The integration will reload when detection completes.

presets.title: Configuration Presets
presets.description: Apply pre-configured settings optimized for common use cases. These presets will modify multiple settings at once.

data.confirm_preset: I understand this will modify multiple settings

preset_descriptions.off_grid_solar: Optimized for standalone solar and battery systems with no grid connection. Prioritizes solar and battery power. Disables AC charging. Use when: Operating fully off-grid with solar as primary power source.
preset_descriptions.rv_solar_generator: Optimized for RV and trailer applications with solar panels and occasional generator use. Uses solar power first, battery second, and generator as backup when connected. Charges battery from both solar (priority) and generator (backup). Ideal for: Mobile/off-grid living with solar panels and portable generator backup.
preset_descriptions.grid_tied_solar: Optimized for grid-connected systems with solar priority. Uses solar first, grid as backup. Maintains battery health with smart charging. Use when: Connected to grid but want to maximize solar usage and reduce electricity bills.
preset_descriptions.ups_mode: Optimized for uninterruptible power supply applications. Grid power primary, battery backup for outages. Fast switching, narrow AC input range for clean power. Use when: Protecting sensitive equipment from power outages and requiring seamless transition.
preset_descriptions.time_of_use: Optimized for Time-of-Use electricity rates. Charges battery during off-peak hours, discharges during peak hours. Maximizes cost savings. Use when: Utility has time-based pricing and you want to minimize electricity costs.
